ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did the subject take a EEG exam?
"If the participant has had EEG, provide the age in months when they had EEG"
Notes: Age in years using two digit format

ElementDescription: "If the participant has had EEG, provide the age in years when they had EEG"
Notes: Age in months using two digit format

ElementDescription: Has the participant been diagnosed with Autism?
"If the participant has been diagnosed with autism, who gave this diagnosis?"
Has the participant been diagnosed with seizures?
Notes: CPEA STAART: -7 = Don't know; -8 = Refused to answer; -9 = Does not apply

ElementDescription: Is child having seizures currently?
ValueRange: Yes; No; Don't Know (DK); Not Applicable (N/A)

ElementDescription: Did the subject recieve another diagnosis?
ValueRange: Yes; No; Don't Know (DK); Not Applicable (N/A)

ElementDescription: What other diagnoses has the participant had?
